children.subject: Sure, I'll look into it.
How does someone register for that cs-intended mailing list?

@First anon: I'll send out an email regarding Gireeja Ranade's events tomorrow
@Second anon: lists.berkeley.edu should work
bump

I sent the email out to the lists at 10am. I don't know if they were ever approved by the managers of the list.
.
I'm subscribed to the cs-majors@eecs.berkeley.edu list but didn't receive the email. :(

Thanks for posting this! Can this message be sent out to everyone in the mailing lists? I was thinking of a message like this one:
---------- Forwarded message ---------- From: Sarah Van Nostrand <svannostrand@eecs.berkeley.edu> Date: Mon, Mar 2, 2015 at 10:29 AM Subject: [cs-majors] Next Student-Faculty Lunch: Professors Abbeel and Ayazifar, 3/10! To: eecs-ugrads@eecs.berkeley.edu, cs-intended@eecs.berkeley.edu, cs-majors@eecs.berkeley.edu Dear Students; We hope you will consider joining us for our next student/faculty lunch! This is a great opportunity to have a delicious meal while getting to know your faculty in a casual atmosphere. We will be hosting two lunches on Tuesday, March 10th from 11am-12pm. Come enjoy food and conversation with either Professor Pieter Abbeel or Professor Babak Ayazifar. If you're interested in participating in this event, please fill out this brief form as soon as possible. You'll have until 10am on Tuesday, 3/3 to add your name, and we'll randomly select participants then. **You will need to be signed into your Berkeley account to view the form.** You will be contacted soon to notify you if you've been selected for the lunch. Please let me know if you have any questions! Thanks! Sarah -- Sarah Van Nostrand Associate Director of Undergraduate Matters Electrical Engineering & Computer Sciences UC Berkeley 203 Cory Hall Berkeley, CA 94702 (510) 664-7181 svannostrand@berkeley.edu
The front page on eecs.berkeley.edu isn't for this type of announcement.
Similarly to the above, will this be added to the announcements section of http://eecs.berkeley.edu/?
Peter-Michael Osera has accepted a position elsewhere and thus his events have been dropped.

A list of the events and their descriptions and times:

Lecturer Candidate Events

Fill this out if you're interested in attending the lecturer candidate talks. All are welcome. :) There are three types of events: Pedagogical Seminar: What the candidate has done before, future plans, and "vision"; professors attend this; ugrads welcome Meet with undergrads: Small group discussion/Q&A with the undergraduates; usually capped at 10 students Mock class presentation: Candidate teaches a mock lecture or discussion on a topic of their choice; ugrads welcome
  • Gireeja Ranade - Pedagogical Seminar - 3/9/2015 - 4:30-5:30
  • Gireeja Ranade - Meet with undergrads - 3/10/2015 - 9:30-10:15
  • Gireeja Ranade - Mock class presentation - 3/10/2015 - 10:30 -11:30
  • Peter-Michael Osera - Pedagogical Seminar - 3/12/2015 - 4:30-5:30
  • Peter-Michael Osera - Meet with undergrads - 3/12/2015 - 5:30-​6:15
  • Peter-Michael Osera - Mock class presentation - 3/13/2015 - 10:30-11:30
Why was this marked resolved without an answer?

Sorry, I thought I replied to this. The point of these events is to get to know the candidate and get a feel for cultural fit and vision. It's good to hear that the candidate is well liked and received, but that sort of thing is already noted. Thus there's no direct way to support a candidate.
Gireeja? Just hire her. She was an amazing lecturer for CS70 when Sahai was out last semester, and she's absolutely killing it in EE16A. Is there any way a student can support a candidate?
Not sure. Chances are the results will come out much later. That link is is a draft. It does not provide any definite info regarding the PSOE candidates.
I really would like to know who's been selected. Can you post an update here when the PSOE candidate has been chosen?
I won't know any sooner than you will.
(But if I do happen to find out, I'll try to spread the word)

How/when do we find out who has been hired? Josh Hug is listed as teaching CS10 in Fall 2015 and CS61B in Spring 2016 according to http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Scheduling/CS/schedule-draft.html, so did he win?

history.content: We're interviewing lecturer candidates for the CS department. Next week, each candidate has (among other things) a pedagogy seminar, an informal chat with the undergrads, and a chance to hold a mock lecture/discussion on a topic of their choice. If you're interested in participating, please fill out the following form. http://goo.gl/forms/cFKrXX7X8E All are welcome, but space is limited. The chat will be particularly impacted, see the form description for details. I'll contact people by the end of this week with more info. Let me know in followups if you have questions. Thanks! :)

The chat will be particularly impacted, see the form description for details. I'll contact people by the end of this week with more info. Let me know in followups if you have questions. Thanks! :) #pin

history.content:
We're interviewing lecturer candidates for the CS department.

Next week, each candidate has (among other things) a pedagogy seminar, an informal chat with the undergrads, and a chance to hold a mock lecture/discussion on a topic of their choice. If you're interested in participating, please fill out the following form. 

http://goo.gl/forms/cFKrXX7X8E

All are welcome, but space is limited. The chat will be particularly impacted, see the form description for details.
I'll contact people by the end of this week with more info.
Let me know in followups if you have questions. Thanks! :)

We're interviewing lecturer candidates for the CS department. Next week, each candidate has (among other things) a pedagogy seminar, an informal chat with the undergrads, and a chance to hold a mock lecture/discussion on a topic of their choice. If you're interested in participating, please fill out the following form. http://goo.gl/forms/cFKrXX7X8E
All are welcome, but space is limited. The chat will be particularly impacted, see the form description for details.
I'll contact people by the end of this week with more info.
Let me know in followups if you have questions. Thanks! :)
